intro: Corispermum nitidulum, commonly known as the smooth bladderwrack, is a small annual herbaceous plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, fleshy, bladder-like leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to arid and saline environments, often found in coastal regions and salt marshes. Its ability to thrive in harsh, saline conditions makes it an important component of these unique ecosystems.
